docs.snippet: Researchers found C.T.E., a disease linked to football and boxing, in a soccer player who loved to head the ball, although they said the cause was inconclusive....
docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers found C.T.E., a disease linked to football and boxing, in a soccer player who loved to head the ball, although they said the cause was inconclusive.
docs.abstract: Signs of chronic traumatic encephalopathy are discovered in 29-year-old former soccer player Patrick Grange, strongest indication yet that the condition is not limited to athletes who play sports known for violent collisions, like football and boxing; condition could have arisen from 'heading' the soccer ball, though researchers are not yet certain of a cause.

headline.main: Brain Trauma Extends to the Soccer Field
headline.print_headline: Brain Trauma Extends to the Soccer Field
